title: Nerita albicilla
text:
Nerita albicilla, <a href="common%20name">common name</a> the blotched nerite, is a <a href="species">species</a> of <a href="sea%20snail">sea snail</a>, a marine <a href="gastropod">gastropod</a> <a href="mollusk">mollusk</a> in the <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> <a href="Neritidae">Neritidae</a>.
Description.
"N. albicilla" grows up to 4 cm; its <a href="gastropod%20shell">shell</a> surface is smooth or with slight transverse ridges; it has small pustules and four weak teeth on the <a href="columella%20%28gastropod%29">columella</a>. Its outer shell color is variegated black and white, occasionally with three conspicuous bands. The interior is white, with a pinkish-grey, granular <a href="operculum%20%28gastropod%29">operculum</a>.
Distribution.
Tropical Indo-Pacific
Habitat.
It is found on rocky cliffs, on rocks in the littoral fringe, and sometimes on <a href="mangrove">mangrove</a> trees.
